description: This course examines the ethical teachings of Jesus as found in the canonical Gospels (with special focus on the Sermon on the Mount), explores how these teachings have been understood at some major moments in Western history, and brings them to bear on the task of contemporary ethical reflection. Issues examined include, for example, non-violence, social and economic justice, sexuality, and ethnic conflict. Counts toward ancient studies major. Prerequisites: completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor.
name: The Ethics of Jesus
prerequisites: Prerequisites: completion of BTS-T or permission of instructor.
